attributes.action: Change the Speed Limit on the Crowland Road Peterborough
attributes.additional_details:
This road has taken too many lives. It is a death trap and the surface is uneven. The vehicles end up in ditches either side of the road.
My daughter 12 weeks ago was another innocent victim of this road, she is laying in Addenbrooks with life changing injuries. The drivers sadly passed away. This road has always been known for the poor condition and accidents are becoming more frequent. This road requires government attention to change the speed and see about resurfacing the uneven area's that motorists may not see in bad or poor visibility weather.
I am unsure of how many fatalities this road has taken but it has taken too many.
Appreciate the government to review this road as a matter of urgency.
attributes.background: Speed of the road needs to be drastically reduced due to numerous accidents. The road is very uneven and requires attention. Numerous accidents occur and end up fatal. Even a camera to reduce speeding. This road requires maintenance.

rejection.details:
Local decisions about speed limits are a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

If you are concerned about speed limits in your area you could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
